title: Induced current - loop moving into B-field

content.prompt: A square loop of wire moves to the right toward a uniform magnetic field directed into the page, as shown. As the loop moves into the field but before its left end is entirely inside the field, which of the following correctly describes the direction of the current induced in the wire and provides the correct justification?

choices.label: The current in the wire is counterclockwise because the magnetic flux is increasing with a magnetic field directed into the page.
The current in the wire is counterclockwise because the magnetic flux through the loop remains constant with a magnetic field directed into the page.
The current in the wire is clockwise because the magnetic flux is increasing with a magnetic field directed into the page.
The current in the wire is clockwise because the magnetic flux through the loop remains constant with a magnetic field directed into the page.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
